column2: Minister of State at the Department of the Taoiseach (Deputy Joe McHugh)
Minister of State at the Department of the Taoiseach (Deputy Joe McHugh)
Minister of State at the Department of the Taoiseach (Deputy Joe McHugh)
Minister of State at the Department of the Taoiseach (Deputy Joe McHugh)
column5: The business for tomorrow is No. 11, Further Revised Estimates, back from committee; No. 12, Supplementary Estimates, back from committee; No. 25, motion re Permanent Structured Cooperation, PESCO; No. 27, Public Service Pay and Pensions Bill 2017 - Committee and Remaining Stages (resumed); and No. 32a, statements on climate change. It is proposed, notwithstanding anything in Standing Orders, that No. 10a, a motion re referral to committee of the motion re Permanent Structured Cooperation shall be taken now without debate and any division demanded thereon will be taken immediately. No. 10b, the introduction to committee of the Technological Universities Bill 2015 shall be taken immediately thereafter without debate and any division demanded thereon will be taken immediately. The Dáil shall sit later than 7.48 p.m. tomorrow night and shall adjourn on the conclusion of the Topical Issue Debate. The motion re Permanent Structured Cooperation shall be taken tomorrow following the Supplementary Estimates and shall conclude after three and a half hours.In the opening round, speeches of a Minister, Minister of State and the spokespersons of the main parties and groups shall not exceed 15 minutes each, with speeches of all other Members not to exceed five minutes each, with a five minute wrap-up by a Minister or a Minister of State. All Members may share time.  The voting block will take place on the conclusion of the motion re Permanent Structured Co-operation and the suspension of the House under Standing Order 25(1) shall take place thereafter for 40 minutes.  Statements re climate change shall be taken not later than 7.40 p.m. and Topical Issues shall be taken not later than 9.40 p.m. or on the conclusion of the statements re climate change, whichever is the earlier.

column2: Minister of State at the Department of the Taoiseach (Deputy Joe McHugh)
column5: I move:That the proposal that Dáil Éireann approves Ireland’s participation in Permanent Structured Cooperation, pursuant to the provisions of section 3 of the Defence (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2009, be referred to the Select Committee on Foreign Affairs and Trade, and Defence, in accordance with Standing Order 84A(3)(b), which, not later than 7th December, 2017, shall send a message to the Dáil in the manner prescribed in Standing Order 90, and Standing Order 89(2) shall accordingly apply.

column2: Minister of State at the Department of the Taoiseach (Deputy Joe McHugh)
column5: I move:That, pursuant to Standing Order 154, it be an instruction to the Committee to which the Technological Universities Bill 2015 may be recommitted in respect of certain amendments, that it has power to make provision in the Bill to provide for investigations into the performance of functions of and provision of information by technological universities, the Institute for Advanced Studies and the National College of Art and Design, and, in relation to Institutes of Technology and Dublin Institute of Technology, to amend inspection provisions to provide for investigations into the performance of their functions and to amend provisions relating to supply of information, and to make necessary consequential amendments including to the title of the Bill.
